comment.shortText: Iniquity App

tags.text: The super cool command line interface to Iniquity.

Invoking via the shell
```shell
iq cli -h
```

Invoking via yargs programatically
```typescript
import CLI from "@iniquitybbs/cli"
const cli: yargs.CommandModule = new CLI()
```

comment.shortText: Iniquity CLI

tags.text: The main entry into all iniquity cli commands that are available.
{yargs.CommandModule}

comment.shortText: All remaining options
Iniquity Archive

tags.text: A growing collection of all things Iniquity. Past and present. For use in helping build your bbs.

```typescript
import { Iniquity } from "@iniquitybbs/core"
import { Assets } from "@iniquitybbs/assets"

const iq = new Iniquity()

const welcomeArt = iq.artwork({ basepath: "./iniquity/bbs/assets", filename: Assets.sm_iniq2 })
welcomeArt.render({ clearScreenBefore: true, speed: 100 })

iq.print(`Iniquity comes packed with easy to use assets like ${welcomeArt.filename}`).pause()

iq.hangup()
```

comment.shortText:
The definitive collection of iniquity ansi/asci/pescii text documents.
Collected from various artpacks over the decades, and various incarnations of iniquity.
This one.
Iniquity Archives

tags.text: What I hope will be a really cool way of accessing all of your ANSI/ASCII/PETSCII/GIF/JPEG whatever files.

comment.shortText: Assets constructor options
Iniquity Core

tags.text: This is the Iniquity core bbs library. It's the foundation of any Iniquity application.

```typescript
import BBS from "@iniquitybbs/core"

const mybbs = new BBS()

myIniquity.artwork({ filename: "./path/to/textfile.ans" }).render({ speed: 10 })

myIniquity.say("Pretty cool, right???".newlines(2).color("bright cyan").center()).pause()

myIniquity.disconnect()
```

comment.shortText: toggle true/false to restrict/allow frame movement outside display
Will render a prompt to the screen.
comment.returns: Functions that can be chained to the prompt.

comment.shortText: Terminal information available to iniquity

Will allow you to
render artwork to the screen
comment.returns: An instance of Artwork and its return functions.

tags.text: {@link IQArtworkOptions} to learn more about the available options.

```typescript
const artwork = iq.artwork({ basepath: "/iniquity/core/src/assets/" })
artwork.render({ filename: Assets.we_iniq3 })

iq.artwork({ basepath: "/iniquity/core/src/assets/", filename: Assets.we_iniq3 }).render({ clearScreenBefore: false })
```

comment.shortText: An object containing the various configuration properties.
Displays a prompt (value) and returns a string of user input (ala clent-side JS)
Sends the cursor to a particular coordinates on the screen
Will disconnect the user immediately.
Frame instance
An object containing the various configuration properties.
Sends the cursor to a particular coordinates on the screen
Menu instance
An object containing the various configuration properties.
Display a pause prompt on the screen.

tags.text: This pause prompt does the usual stuff. It also provides a few helpers via its return functions.
{@link IQPauseOptions} to learn more about the available options.

comment.shortText: Prints something to the user. Parses Renegade MCI/Synchronet @- codes.

tags.text: {@link IQPrintOptions} to learn more about the available options.

```typescript
iq.print("Display some text on the screen that can parse @ codes.").center()
iq.print("Display some text on the screen that can parse @ codes.".newlines(2).color("background red"))
iq.print("Display some text on the screen that can parse @ codes.".color("cyan")).pause()
```

comment.shortText: you would like to print on the screen.
Says something to the user. Does not parse MCI/@- codes.

tags.text: {@link IQPrintOptions} to learn more about the available options.

```typescript
iq.say("Say something to the terminal!")
iq.say("This time say something but do some cool string manipulation.".newlines(2).color("bright red").center()).pause()
```

comment.shortText: What you would like to say on the screen.
User stuff
comment.returns: An instance of User and its return functions.

tags.text: It doesn't do much right now. But it does create new users and store them in the SBBS backend.
{@link IUserOptions} to learn more about the available options.

comment.shortText: An object containing the various configuration properties.
Halt the screen for a specified period of time.

tags.text:
iq.wait(100)
wait(10)
this.wait(1000)

comment.shortText: In miliseconds
Decorators
Iniquity Core Artwork

tags.text: Core artwork display and manipulation capabilities

```typescript
import { Artwork } from "@iniquitybbs/core"

const art = new Artwork({ filename: "./path/to/file.ans"})

art.render({ speed: 50}).pause()

art.render({ mode: "line", clearScreenBefore: true }).colorReset().pause()

```

comment.shortText: The Iniquity Artwork rendering class

tags.text: {@link IQArtworkOptions}

```typescript
art.render({ mode: "line", speed: 100 }).clearScreen().pause()
```

Iniquity Core BBS

tags.text: The main class you will use as it wraps all the other classes in a unified API.

```typescript
import BBS from "@iniquitybbs/core/dist/iniquity"

const mybbs = new BBS()

myIniquity.say("Say hi!").pause()

myIniquity.hangup()

```

comment.shortText: In miliseconds

tags.text: {@link IQPauseOptions}

comment.shortText: {@link IQPauseOptions}
Additional functions exported by render

tags.text: pause What pause does.
colorReset Resets the current lines screen color back to normal.

comment.shortText: Resets the screen color

tags.text: {@link IQPauseOptions}

comment.shortText: Artwork render options
The full path to your art folder
A boolean representing if you want the screen cleared before.
Supported character encodings are CP437 and UTF8.
The file name of the artwork you would like to render to the screen
The rendering mode to use. e.g. Line at a time, character at a time, etc.
How fast you would like the artwork rendered to the screen.
Data you would like to be reactive in the menu
The maximum number of the menu event loop that can run.
Basically halt everything for the specified period of milliseconds.
Menu options

tags.text: Some options.
{@link IQMenuOptions}

comment.shortText:
Execute a menu command, with optional callback for working with response data.
This function can also be chained with .gotoxy()

Go to the specified coordinates on the terminal.
This function can also be chained with .command()
Width coordinates.
Height coordinates.
Iniquity bbs string operations

tags.text: Some pretty typical operations most sysops end up wanting apply to strings. Got more ideas? Let me know.
Make sure that colors don't bleed on to the terminal after displaying the text.
How many newlines to display after the text has been displayed.
Will attempt to center the text on the clients terminal.

comment.shortText: User options

tags.text: The name of the user.
The users password.

An experimental Iniquity module decorator for bbs modules

tags.text: ispyhumanfly

Iniquity reactive data model

tags.text: https://www.monterail.com/blog/2016/how-to-build-a-reactive-engine-in-javascript-part-1-observable-objects

comment.shortText: A pretty cool method for working with cursor movement.

tags.text: cursor().down(10).up(12).down().up().down().left(1).right(20).down(12).up(14)

An array of IQCoreAssets to choose from
Say whatever you want, but to the screen

tags.text: say("are we making it here?").pause()

comment.shortText: Iniquity Core Assets

tags.text: A growing collection of all things Iniquity. Past and present. For use in helping build your bbs.

```typescript
import { Iniquity } from "@iniquitybbs/core"
import { Assets } from "@iniquitybbs/assets"

const iq = new Iniquity()

const welcomeArt = iq.artwork({ basepath: "./iniquity/bbs/assets", filename: Assets.sm_iniq2 })
welcomeArt.render({ clearScreenBefore: true, speed: 100 })

iq.print(`Iniquity comes packed with easy to use assets like ${welcomeArt.filename}`).pause()

iq.hangup()
```

comment.shortText: Assets constructor options
Iniquity Init

tags.text: The super cool command line interface to Iniquity.

Invoking via the shell
```shell
iq init --help
```

Invoking via yargs programatically
```typescript
import Init from "@iniquitybbs/iniquity/dist/src/commands/init"
const init: yargs.CommandModule = new Init()
```

comment.shortText: Iniquity CLI

tags.text: The main entry into all iniquity cli commands that are available.
{yargs.CommandModule}

children.name: describe
children.defaultValue: "Initialize the current directory as an iniquity 3 application."

```typescript
iq.print("Display some text on the screen that can parse @ codes.".color("cyan")).pause()
```

comment.shortText: you would like to print on the screen.
Says something to the user. Does not parse MCI/@- codes.

tags.text: {@link IQPrintOptions} to learn more about the available options.

```typescript
iq.say("Say something to the terminal!")
iq.say("This time say something but do some cool string manipulation.".newlines(2).color("bright red").center()).pause()
```

comment.shortText: What you would like to say on the screen.
User stuff
comment.returns: An instance of User and its return functions.

tags.text: It doesn't do much right now. But it does create new users and store them in the SBBS backend.
{@link IUserOptions} to learn more about the available options.

comment.shortText: An object containing the various configuration properties.
Halt the screen for a specified period of time.

tags.text:
iq.wait(100)
wait(10)
this.wait(1000)

comment.shortText: In miliseconds
Terminal information available to iniquity

Will allow you to
render artwork to the screen
comment.returns: An instance of Artwork and its return functions.

tags.text: {@link IQArtworkOptions} to learn more about the available options.

```typescript
const artwork = iq.artwork({ basepath: "/iniquity/core/src/assets/" })
artwork.render({ filename: Assets.we_iniq3 })

iq.artwork({ basepath: "/iniquity/core/src/assets/", filename: Assets.we_iniq3 }).render({ clearScreenBefore: false })
```
